text: in retreat Iraqi government forces
leaving the city of Ramadi which Islamic
state now claims to have control over
these pictures can't be verified but
they do appear to show the withdrawal of
government soldiers there have been
battling is fighters for months but in
the past week they've lost key strategic
points and now it appears the entire
city Ramadi is the capital of Iraq's
largest province and bar and is just 70
miles from the Iraqi capital Baghdad is
is in control of large swaths of the
region from the Turkish border in the
north through Syria and across northern
Iraq support for is is widespread across
this area and despite being pushed back
in some areas it has now claimed full
control of Ramadi even though the u.s.
is playing down the city's strategic
role the West will see this advance by
is as a huge problem as for the people
facing is forces tens of thousands have
been fleeing the city for Baghdad in the
past few days terrified of what is
control will bring Keith Doyle BBC news
